author: I D A Morrison
comment: The app works fine for what it advertises: launch a tasker task from your watch. It seems to sync your favourites and folders every time you launch it on the watch however which gives running any task a 5-6 second delay. Is there any way you can speed that up? Wear 2.0 devices tend to have plenty of space for storing data so I'm not sure why it syncs each time...

author: Matthew L
comment: *update* After purchasing premium and setting up a complication I can no longer get the app to work, constantly getting connectivity errors. Doesn't seem very stable *end update* Tasker shortcuts as watchface complications work as expected, but I wish you could modify the name and icon. All tasks use the default icon and uses the Tasker name as the label, would be nice to change.

author: Andrew Gregg
comment: I'm having the same trouble as Anton.  I can place multiple complications on a face and they will have their correct names, but the buttons will all trigger the same (most recently placed) task.  A second, minor, issue: complications are only showing the default "lightning bolt" icon, despite an icon having been selected in Tasker and in WearTasker.

author: Jonathan Chen
comment: Worked once, now says "No connection". Might work again after reboot, but frankly, not worth it...

author: Anton Kostov
comment: Great job with wear widgets, super handy! But a have a bug with widgets, all of them have different names, but trigger the same task - last one chosen.

author: Rasmus Schøler Sørensen
comment: Never got it to work, kept giving me "no connection" error on the watch, even though watch is connected (as reported in wear app), and other apps on watch have connection to phone.

author: leefelk
comment: Got it working for like 5 minutes after some trying, after that I only get "no connection" even tho the watch is connected

author: Ralph Mettier
comment: This used to be a great app on my old Moto 360, but now on Fossil Explorist Q and AW 2 it freezes the watch when I open the app.

author: Jack Collins
comment: Didn't work on Galaxy J5, kept saying watch not connected when it was.

author: Wilfred Tam
comment: Not working, keep saying "make sure watch is connected", even though watch is already connected.

author: Luis Quezada
comment: Never worked. Alwayd displayed no connection.

author: Steve Mann
comment: This works great for me and a handy way of creating shortcuts to Tasker actions.

author: Michael AskMe
comment: Would have been nice to test functionality before purchase. Would suggest a short trial period.

author: Reed Schimmel
comment: Doesn't work

author: Fay Pork
comment: Tried all the steps in the FAQ. Uninstalled and reinstalled at least 4 times. Eventually the app was pushed to the watch. I never experienced with any other watch apps. Developer responded really fast though. This app looks promising.

reply.author: Cuberob
reply.content: Hi Fay, sorry to hear you are having issues installing the app on your watch. I'm looking into the issue but have so far failed to reproduce it. Could you contact me by mail so we can try to debug it further? Thanks.  Cheers, Rob

title: App not installed on the watch (Fixed but don't know)

author: Dario Ivone
comment: Good App, but needs updates!  In my case voice tasker don't work. Suggest: ability to change background notifications! (now they are ugly)

reply.author: Cuberob
reply.content: Hi dario, Thanks for your feedback. The app has since been updated with a bit of material design paint..! Hope you enjoy it. Cheers, Rob

author: Paul Haines
comment: Works well once installed, but i had to reset my watch this morning and re-bind it to my phone. Since then it won't install on the watch. I tried everything in the FAQ and a number of un-install + reset + reinstall iterations but it simply won't push the app to the watch. Can anyone recommend an alternative?
title: Won't install on watch

author: Gerben Meijer
comment: Great way to access tasker tasks, but should cache on watch. Takes around 4 seconds to open the tasklist and another 4 per folder.
title: Good but slow

author: Hayden Whittle
comment: This app is great, when it works. It suffers from the app taking ages to load my favourites on my watch. If this can be fixed I wish I could give the developer $10.

author: William Larson
comment: has not been reliable. Shows on watch but displays a message stating "NO Connection".  I hope the app will be debugged.

author: Beau Williams
comment: App seems a little slower with the new update but otherwise it seems much nicer. It would be nice to have a black theme option for amoled devices

reply.author: Cuberob
reply.content: Hi Beau, Thanks for your feedback. The theme option is now officially on my to do list! Cheers, Rob

title: Amoled theme

author: Chris Unsted
comment: Great way to trigger all sorts without digging out the phone. Use it everyday for sending quick messages and changing phone settings.

author: Markus Kufner
comment: Circuil is always rotating but nothing happens
title: No function with my LG g watch r

author: Rudi Havenga
comment: Fine. Auto exit currently not working. When it does, I will purchase.

author: Jeff Faber
comment: Works great

author: Jonathan Gil
comment: I use this to display contextual remote controls for my home automation. Problem is that you can't turn off haptic feedback so using this a lot drains my battery quite severely. Please consider adding the option to disable haptic feedback. Multiple pages per wear notification would be cool too
title: Great app. 1 suggestion

author: Dale Driver
comment: However I dislike seeing Task 1, Task 2, Task 3 because it doesn't tell me which task it's associated with and it clutter up wear's app list. I would upgrade to pro if there is option to allow me to rename those to something meaningful, or not list them at all.
title: Almost worth the purchase

author: Liam Giri
comment: I have no desire to set quick tasks on my watch, yet I'm stuck with 3 additional icons on my watch. The app needs the ability to hide these.
title: Needs ability to hide "Tasks"

author: Sean Misa
comment: It's a good app that can help access my Tasker apps quickly from my watch, but I'm having problems with the voice actions. When I say "start task 1" my watch hears it as "start task one" and doesn't complete the task. Same for "start task 2" to "start task to". Can you change the words so that Google can hear it correctly?

author: Rod Savard
comment: One suggestion is to add an option to dismiss the wear notification automatically after tapping. I have one configured as a 'quick action' and would like it to disappear after tapping to trigger tasker.  Thank you. Edit: thanks for the workaround!

reply.author: Cuberob
reply.content:
Hi Rod, 
Thanks for your suggestion, I will consider it for a future update. As for now, you could create a dedicated quick task within tasker that includes the "dismiss notification" weartasker action. This way the notification will be dismissed after execution.

title: Very useful

author: Rachael Erdman
comment: Great app! Would love to have the option of auto-dismissing the notification after launching the quick task. It would be nice to make a shortcut to a few tasks, as well (if there is a way to do this if you don't want to assign a voice command, I missed it).

author: Shayne Bergan
comment: Works great, Is it possible to rename "start task 1" I would like to just say "Okay Google turn lights on" ect, Not sure if it's possible.  Cheers

author: Aristide Mooyaart
comment: Nice app, but having paid for the voice actions I'm pretty disappointed that after google correctly recognises the command it does a google search for 'Start task 1' rather than you know starting task 1!

reply.author: Cuberob
reply.content: Hi, the behavior of the voice tasks had unfortunately  indeed been blocked by Google in an Android wear update. The new version has a new approach, where it uses the "take a note functionality" to allow for your own custom voice commands and omit this problem. Hope you enjoy it and the refreshed design! Cheers, Rob

author: Dillon Cr
comment: I hope the developer gives an option to remove the icons for each task from the wear app drawer so it does note have such a cluttered effect but overall the app is perfect and a real time saver
title: Great

author: László Juhász
comment: Pleasen fix this! None of the actions work...
title: Missing Permission?

author: Roy Anati
comment: Can't select icon for third favorite task. No longer compatible with mini launcher.
title: A bit buggy

author: John Smith
comment: App force closes any time I try to set task 1,2,3, as well as on a lot of other functions.  Moto 360, OnePlus One
title: Force closes, Can't do anything

author: HGH Ff Grantor
comment: Uninstalled. Also requires $3.00 purchase of tasker.
title: Crashes every time

author: Brian Badalucco
comment: Great Tasker plug in for Android Wear!   Hope the developer keeps pushing it farther.
title: Love it, getting more out of my watch because of it

author: Jordan Adair
comment: I can trigger the notification from tasker to the watch, but cannot use the task1,2,3 on the watch by themselves?
title: I can't find any manuals!
